title: “Speed up steps against Priyantha Kumara killers”
content: Pakistan’s influential Council of Islamic Ideology (CII) has called for speedy steps against those involved in the murder of Sri Lankan factory manager Priyantha Kumara Diyawadana in Sialkot last December.The CII said violence against anyone on allegations of blasphemy is contrary to Islamic principles and Sharia.A CII meeting, which was presided over by its chairman Qibla Ayaz and attended by 17 religious scholars, also condemned similar violent incidents in Khanewal, Swabi and Kahror Pacca.Referring to the Sialkot killing, it said that all those involved in the incident should be taken to task at the earliest so that confidence of the nation could be restored in the country’s legal and judicial system.According to an official handout, the meeting observed that the real culprits, who did commit blasphemy, should be taken to task immediately and also those who took the law into their hands, and that there should be no delay in this regard on the part of courts.It said the CII also suggested formation of a commission that would come up with recommendations for preventing such violent incidents.
